content.label:
This game manages to make a match-3 even more frustrating and luck based than normal. You slide whole rows and columns, instead of moving around individual pieces. It's not a better change.

The rest of the game is cute, but doesn't overcome its central annoyance.

title.label: If I could give it a 0 I would

content.label: This is one of the most aggravating games I've ever played, nothing big ruins this game, but a million small things do. I don't know about everybody else, but when it tells me I win everyday I die, I get infuriated. It's annoying. So is it cycles through options when you get to the next level of the run, yet it always lands on the same thing. Mist for example. Also you never seem to have the correct tiles for a given situation.
I don't get the hype
Highly recommend.
Game is great and is challenging, so I never want to stop playing it. Great time waster! Very good game if you are going to put in the time. Looking forward to another game in the series!

title.label: Really fun twist on match-3 games

content.label: You Must Build A Boat is a fun, 8-bit-inspired match-3 type of game. Each run has missions and the difficulty ramps up at a good rate. It would be nice to be able to pause during the runs, but that's a minor complaint. I really enjoyed the upgrade system and all the different enemies. Lots of fun!

title.label: A great sequel and great fun too

content.label:
The game builds on the charm of the previous game. The graphics are the same as the first game, yet, it is still a new experience. It takes a little patience but it is rewarded by a sense of accomplishment when one completes the game. Yes, it is a time waster. It is also a lot of fun.

I have now completed the game twice. That second time the difficulty level is increased. This made it more challenging. I do not know how many difficulty levels there are. I enjoyed it even more the second time. Good replay value!

This game was so fun it had amazing concepts and I absolutely loved it and it was my favorite game on my phone. Then one day I got onto it and it had deleted all of my progress for absolutely no reason. My phone hadn't restarted or anything. If you can fix my problem I will rate this game five stars but for now I have put one
Addicting and engaging!!! Really worth the purchase. Found myself looking to play whenever I had a few minutes of time between things!

title.label: Loved the 1st game, I HATE this one

content.label:
Short and to the point: same mechanics as the first but with less choice, you're forced to progress the difficulty with NO WAY to run on an easier difficulty to grind out money for upgrades.

It's practically inevitable you'll get to a point where you're stuck on an objective with preset conditions that you can not beat and there is nothing you can do.

===Case in point===
It won't let me play without adding a "quest", the only quest left makes it so only monsters spawn (no chests for loot), you have to kill 6 monsters and they all regenerate health. I can usually get 2-3 down (despite healing back to full in less than 2 seconds) before the monsters stop taking damage, their health bars just sitting in place, and I get to watch the screen slowly scroll to the left to defeat. 

Everyone who says they love it probably has not played that far are has been incredibly lucky.
Every time I completed a hard objective that was blocking progress it was due to pure luck.

Replay 10000000, the previous game is better in every way.

title.label: It's OK but need more time

content.label: The game is OK but I really like it but I rated 1 star because you need to add in unlimited time and make it easier.
I'm upset now that I beat it. I guess I'll accept the challenge and restart lol

You can beat the game consistently and easily by sliding and tapping your finger across the screen randomly during the matching process.  When you can do better by accident than you can on purpose, you know you're playing a poorly designed game.

title.label: A great game I don't care for

content.label: I tried really hard to like this game but just couldn't. It has great production values and solid gameplay. I just didn't care for it. I think the frustration of losing battles when there's no good blocks on screen got to me.

Some people complain about the fast pace of this game, but YMBAB wouldn't be as good as it is without it. The stress that the monsters create by inching you toward the edge of the screen makes for some frantic gameplay that is usually reserved for "bullet hell" shooter types. The challenges are always evolving, ranging from passable, to "why the hell is this so impossible"; yet never feel like they rely on luck.
Simple to learn and fun to play, a matching game with a fantasy dungeon crawl backdrop, cool pixel-art style characters. Recommended!

A fanstatic game that becomes very addicting very quickly, and is unlike any other great game in the AppStore since it doesn't need timers or lives to refill over time as an addiction supplement. Solid 10/10

I like the game, on paper, but in practice it is just frustrating. The act of sliding sections around is not conducive to fast paced gameplay... At least not here. 

I found myself more often than not frantically looking at the screen for something to move into place and hearing "thump, thump, thump" as the enemies hit me. Surely I'm not great at it, and I understand the quick loop of the game, but it didn't translate to fun for me. 

I wouldn't recommend You Must Build A Boat.

I thought the matching was just one element.. IT'S THE ENTIRE GAME! And am I supposed to be matching the tiles the entire time or do I waste them if I match them while I'm running between chest and enemies.. I had no idea what 2 of the currencies were until I had completed several of the quest. You don't ever build a boat, you don't get to choose any placement of the characters in the boat, you match tiles until you get knocked off the screen (which happens often) and then your boat gets bigger with some new goofy character and that's the entire game as far as I can tell.. Don't be fooled by the best of 2015 bull.

I was skeptical at first about this game, as I always am with mobile games, but it turned out to be good. I spent lots of time "winning"(or losing, rather), but it was always exciting to get a new crew member or piece of gear. 10/10 would build a boat again.

It seemed pretty boring at first because it looked like candy crush and games like that so I downloaded it and I didn't realize it was freaking 6$ and I thought I better be worth it and I took one look at it and I was pissedðŸ˜‚

DIFFERENT! This game is fast paced and doesn't hold your hand. You will die again and again -- and that is a good thing! It throws the normal match three mechanics on it's a**. Dungeon crawler + match three = AWESOME! EightyEight is great.

title.label: So Frustrating That It Is Fun

content.label: There is a constant cycle of playing and thinking you are doing good, only to remember the tiles and enemies appear in random order and you can't get the right combination in time and game over. You then immediately start playing again because you know this time you can beat it because you think you know what tiles you will get and the bad guys you will face.

title.label: Hard, but not too hard to enjoy.

content.label:
A lot of negative reviews are saying that it's too hard. I'll admit, it can be frustrating at times, but I've been able to progress through the game at a pretty steady pace. It is challenging, but not overly difficult. 

About the game itself, this is one of the only "match 3" types of games I like at all. Great game.
Very fun

title.label: Like most sequels, it's not as good!

content.label: I loved 10000000.  I matched tiles from beginning to end twice through.  YMBAB, like its older sibling, is a tile-matching battling endless runner, but with a new setting (a boat instead of a dungeon).  It's still fun to play and worth the price.  However, some new gameplay mechanics introduce further elements of randomness, shortening runs and making the game more "grindy" than its predecessor.  I guess that means I get to play it more, but it's a lot less rewarding and satisfying.
Too much relies on random chance, and matching tiles is finicky. Frustrating.
Not even worth 99 cents

At the early levels this game shouldn't be this difficult. It's game for fun or should be. The games difficulty jumps to extremes within the third quest. I appreciate the idea. But there should be ways to skip a quest or tone down early quest. Glad I purchased it on sale for a dollar.

I really thought this game wasn't going to be good
But it is actually really fun ðŸ˜€

I really like this game! It was a bit too fast for me at the beginning, but now that I've had some time to get used to the controls and upgrade my stuff I'm finding it to be quite manageable. It's fun and addicting, but you can play it in short bursts too if you want. I really like how no matter how short a run is, it always says "You Win!" It's just a little thing that makes me feel good about the progress I've made, even if I didn't fulfill a challenge during that run.
The fast pace is not appealing. I'm a fan of puzzles and games that make you think, but this one just stresses me out.

The whole matching tiles thing to fight is stupid and really ruins the game for me. It's not fun, it's slow and annoying and fast and annoying. A chest can have an enemy behind it but you have to unlock the chest before you can attack the enemy but the enemy can attack you. It takes too long to find matches so you end up wasting time. It's just an overall bad game. For a dollar, sure, I guess. Anymore and I'd say it's a rip off.
Played for 20min and couldn't take it anymore.  There is an interesting concept here, but not realized.
This game should be free. I spent 3 dollars on it and deleted it within a few weeks. Also there should be a Santa boss.

I love match 3 games and have played all the popular ones as well as a few indie releases. Yet this game could be my favorite of the whole genre. Satisfying upgrade system with no IAP'S, spectacular soundtrack, great graphical style, fast-paced gameplay with a nice balance of luck and, *yes*, skill. $3 is a steal. Get it!

So, I can definitely see the appeal of this game. But, certain aspects of it make it very unenjoyable for me. Mainly, it's because the gameplay is way too fast. The fact that you can't take as much time as you'd like matching the tiles really bugs me, and knowing that taking a long time actually causes me to die sort of stresses me out while playing, causing me to not even be able to think clearly about matching. So yeah. It's a personal problem for me, obviously a lot of people love this game. So if you are really into fast paced candy crush-type games like this, get it. Also, I don't think a game like this should be $3. $1 at the MOST.
I absolutely love this game! I could play non stop but there is one problem. It is way to difficult. I am in the Jail Dumgeon and I can barely last like 20 seconds.
It genuinely seems fun how ever the matchmaking system in the puzzles is atrocious and I often times can't find or make a match that's useful and have to sit there until I lose.

Yes, I know it is 2016 right now, but this game is worth the money. Absolutely no micro transactions which is rare nowadays and awesome gameplay. It is sort of like a candy crush where you must match three or more or tiles but it executes it greatly. This game is a must-buy and an essential for gamers in the iPhone, iPad and iPod.

title.label: Buy if you like getting frustrated

content.label:
It's fun the first 5 minutes and then you start getting frustrated because you get absolutely no gold for running through dungeons and you'll be lucky to even make it past 3 encounters on 1 run because every single tile they give you is not the one you need; too many times have I "won" because I literally had no tiles to match whatsoever. Would probably play more if they actually had a better algorithm for the tiles but otherwise, stick with 100000000000 or whatever game was before this one. Kinda wish I could get a refund since this game is less of a game than those that are free.

DO NOT BUY
This is honestly not what I expected.
Maybe you have to be a special kind of person to appreciate this game, I just didn't get it

title.label: One of the few good games.

content.label: I honestly had a lot of fun with this game. Each new dungeon had new rules that affected my game play. And now that I have beat it I can prestige and start over or there are daily quests you can do. All around great game.

YMBAB offers fast-paced tile matching that would satisfy anybody looking for a decent puzzler, but when you throw in a rich collection of upgrades to buy and monsters to collect, it becomes really hard to put down. Maybe one more game before bed...
This game is great for 30 minutes.

This game is nearly perfection itself.  Simple to pick up, and perfect for short bursts or longer runs.  Quite challenging, yet rewarding when a quest is completed.  The new daily quest adds even more to the replay value.

title.label: Addictive but not a good game. Not worth 2.99

content.label:
This game seems like it is fun and on the surface when you play it you think you are having fun but it isn't a game work 3 bucks. 

It's a matching game but doesn't give you any strategy or approach. You get random tiles as you progress through a dungeon and just have to hope and pray that you get the right tiles to match whatever you might have to work on that that point. Most of the time I can't even make it through the first phase of a dungeon because I don't have the tiles to defeat an enemy before the time runs out then they make you move so fast to make that you really can't make out a strategy and instead are just aimlessly matching and trying to pay attention to the obstacle you have. 

Then there are dark levels where you can't even decipher what the obstacle is and they still want you to be fast and match the right tiles for the task. As it turns out the game is more of you just repeating a stage over and over and over and over until you finally complete an objective but it's really not that fun and really not work the money I paid for it. No one wants to pay 3 bucks for a game that doesn't even offer any real game play. Don't waste your time or money on this game because in the end you will be disappointed that you paid 3 dollars for a game that you don't even have to think about to play. There are plenty of free games out there that you don't have to put much thought into that would be much more worth your time. TRASH!!
Don't waste your money
I think I liked 10000000 a little more, but YMBAB is a worthy sequel. It's fun to have a new game to work through!
